title: Lee Cain: Senior Johnson adviser to leave Downing Street
description: No 10's director of communications Lee Cain is resigning amid reports of internal tensions.

title: Edmonton police station car crash: Man arrested
description: Officers tackle a man seen pouring petrol on the car and setting it alight in north London.

title: 'Largest ever auctioned' purple-pink diamond sells for $26.6m (£20.1m)
description: The 14-carat Spirit of the Rose diamond is named after the ballet made famous by Vaslav Nijinsky.

title: 'We can't just keep standing in front of the cameras talking about change'
description: Football needs to be at the forefront of societal change, says England boss Gareth Southgate following Greg Clarke's resignation as FA chairman.

title: Chester hospital baby deaths: Nurse Lucy Letby charged with murder
description: Lucy Letby was arrested in 2018 and 2019 as part of a probe into deaths at a Chester hospital.

title: 'We're hoping and praying' - Gomez set for scans on 'upsetting' knee injury
description: Liverpool defender Joe Gomez is to have further tests on a knee injury suffered during training with England.

title: Covid: Four UK nations discuss joint Christmas approach
description: Common rules for people to follow across the UK are being considered for the festive period.

title: What Trump could do after leaving the White House
description: Will he run again, relaunch his TV career, or make retirement great again at his golf resorts?

title: Covid: UK first country in Europe to pass 50,000 deaths
description: It is the first European nation to pass the landmark, with 595 deaths recorded in the past 24 hours.

title: Croydon Council bans new spending under Section 114 notice
description: All new expenditure at the authority is halted amid "severe ongoing financial challenges".

title: 'Murder hornets': More nests likely to be found in US
description: Around 200 queen hornets were found in a nest extracted in Washington in October, scientists say.

title: Northerners prefer football to ballet, Jake Berry MP says
description: Conservative Jake Berry made the comparison as he warned "northern culture" is being hit by Covid.

title: ‘I have to pay £40,000 because of flammable cladding’
description: “Flammable cladding on my block of flats is costing me £40,000.”

title: Covid-19: Universities to oversee student exodus for Christmas
description: They are being asked to travel in the seven days after the national lockdown in England ends.

title: Roblox gamers must pay to die with an 'oof'
description: It follows a copyright dispute with sound engineer who originally created the sound for another game.

title: Capital gains tax: Rate should double, says government review
description: The chancellor commissioned the report in July as part of efforts to cover Covid-19 costs.

title: Greg Clarke resignation will not change things at Football Association, says Joleon Lescott
description: The resignation of chairman Greg Clarke is not going to improve diversity at the Football Association, says former England defender Joleon Lescott.

title: 'I was four when we last qualified' - Liverpool's Robertson says Scots inspired by hopes of nation
description: Scotland will not be cowed by the weight of history, says captain Andy Robertson, as he pledged "the hopes of a nation" can inspire his side in the Euro 2020 play-off final with Serbia.

title: I am desperate to go home, says student with vulnerable family
description: As students' Christmas return plans are revealed, one tells of her desperation to be at home.

title: Graham Norton to leave BBC Radio 2 after 10 years
description: The presenter is to exit his Saturday morning programme before the end of this year.

title: In pictures: Two minutes' silence to mark Armistice Day
description: Pictures from around the UK capture the moment people paid respect to those who died in conflict.

title: Wild Mountain Thyme: Is an Irish accent the hardest to master?
description: The accents in Wild Mountain Thyme, starring Jamie Dornan and Emily Blunt, raise eyebrows in Ireland.

title: NFL; Philip Rivers, Dalvin Cook & Washington Football team versus the New York Giants
description: Osi Umenyiora and Jason Bell recap some bits you may have missed from week nine in the NFL including a "tackle" attempt by Colts quarterback Philip Rivers.

title: Greg Clarke: Why FA chairman's comments are so offensive
description: Greg Clarke quits after using an offensive term to describe black players.

title: British Cycling: Senior coach Kevin Stewart sacked for 'inappropriate relationships' with riders
description: British Cycling sacks a senior coach for gross misconduct and a "long-term pattern of inappropriate relationships" with riders.

title: Stockton boy spread McDonald's drive-thru kindness
description: Blake paid for the food of the man behind him, prompting everyone in the queue to follow suit.

title: Prof Van-Tam: 'I would be at front of vaccine queue'
description: England's Deputy Chief Medical Officer says he has "absolute trust" in the safety of a vaccine.

title: Rupert Grint posts photo of baby daughter in Instagram debut
description: The Harry Potter actor jokes he is "only 10 years late" in signing up to the social media platform.

title: Wu-Tang Clan's RZA: Change in poverty levels is too slow
description: The rapper discusses his latest movie, poverty in the US and the future of hip-hop.

title: Edmund De Wind: The war hero remembered in Comber and Canada
description: Edmund De Wind, a Victoria Cross recipient who died in WWI, is honoured in Comber and Canada.

title: Masters 2020: What does an autumn tournament mean for Augusta National?
description: Nineteen months since Tiger Woods won a fifth Green Jacket, how will Augusta look and what impact will an autumn Masters have?

title: Tom Allen: The idea of gay shame still pervades
description: The comedian discusses the shame he felt growing up gay in the 1990s, and how he overcame it.

title: Australian PM under fire for interrupting female minister
description: Senior minister Anne Ruston was asked whether the culture for women in parliament had improved.

title: Rugby School to sell 'rare' Shakespeare and Dickens books
description: One volume from the private school's library is estimated to fetch up to £50,000 at auction.

title: Covid-19: New lockdown brings new DIY projects
description: Whether it's knitting or building a pizza oven, many are using the time to learn a new skill.

title: Why Shetland's empty islands were abandoned
description: Inhabitants left many of the islands when life there became too difficult for them.

title: CEO Secrets: The dads getting entrepreneurial in lockdown
description: The CEO Secrets series hears from three fathers who have juggled start-ups and childcare in lockdown.

title: ‘I’m trapped by my mortgage – let me escape’
description: MPs are looking at proposals that could free thousands of people from high-interest mortgages

title: Coronavirus: Denmark shaken by cull of millions of mink
description: Why the "Cluster 5" coronavirus mutation in fur farms has led to a nationwide cull and a political outcry.

title: Mexico ambush: Mormon families waiting for justice a year on from massacre
description: A year ago, three Mormon women and six of their children were massacred in Mexico's Sonora desert. What has happened to the families left behind?

title: Hong Kong's dying news stands tell a story of change
description: What the fate of these street corner fixtures tells us about the fate of the city's proudly free media.

title: Second wave: NHS staff 'feeling the strain'
description: The BBC’s health editor Hugh Pym spent a day at Royal Derby Hospital

title: Immunising the world against Covid-19
description: With new developments in the race for a Covid-19 vaccine, how easy would it be to immunise the world? Tulip Mazumdar reports.

title: Spain lockdown: How domestic workers became prisoners
description: Live-in domestic workers have been confined to some employers' houses during the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Covid: 'It's a relief for us to talk about money'
description: People aged 18 to 24 have taken a Covid-related financial hit but are least likely to open up about it.
